titleStmt.title: The vain insolency of Rome, challenging salvation to her own faction discovered in two letters : the first whereof was written by a priest of the Church of Rome to a gentlewoman of York, that had got out of the snares of the popish superstition : the second sent by the same gentlewoman (instructed by a divine of the Church of England) in answer thereunto.
titleStmt.author: Priest of the Church of Rome.
Gentlewoman of York.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
